sites.SiteDescription: Physiography: Nickerson Moraine. Surrounding vegetation: maple-basswood, Juglans cinerea.
Shallow irregular peat deposit. Physiography: gently rolling ground moraine. Surrounding vegetation: sedge meadow and shrub-carr.
Small fen in interlobate area. Physiography: Allegheny Plateau. Surrounding vegetation: agriculturally disturbed.
Peat accumulation in glacial drainageway. Physiography: generally flat valley floor.

sites.SiteNotes: The Icehouse Bottom site is now innundated by Tellico Reservoir. This site ceased to exist after 1984.
sites.SiteDescription: Backswamp deposits under archeol. site. Physiography: first terrace Little Tennessee River. Surrounding vegetation: agricultural.
Lake in glacial outwash channel. Physiography: Prairie Coteau. Surrounding vegetation: pasture, hayed areas, Populus.
Section on south bank of Sheyenne River. Physiography: Sheyenne River Delta, level.
Marsh maintained by an artesian spring. Physiography: floodplain edge of the Delaware River.
Physiography: Till Plains.
Stream-bank section along Nichols Brook. Physiography: Chaffee outwash plain.
Fen. Physiography: till plain. Surrounding vegetation: wetland.
Interdunal depression. Physiography: Nebraska Sandhills. Surrounding vegetation: grassland.

sites.SiteNotes: Poplar River Formation overlain by ~8m of Sherack Formation.
Pollen has also been described from the section.
sites.SiteDescription: The section of organic silts, sands and clays is exposed in a stream cut adjacent to U.S. Hwy. 62, 3.8 km south of North Collins.
Fluvial deposits in floodplain of Roberts Creek. Physiography: Driftless Area - rolling. Surrounding vegetation: Farmland.
Fluvial deposits in floodplain of Roberts Creek. Physiography: Driftless Area - rolling. Surrounding vegetation: Farmland.
Fluvial deposits in floodplain of Roberts Creek. Physiography: Driftless Area - rolling. Surrounding vegetation: Farmland.

sites.SiteNotes:
Baker et al. (1996) includes description of plant fossils found in the Roberts Creek site.
Baker et al. (1993) provides an interpretation of the Euro-American settlement based on pollen plant macroscopic, and insect remains.
sites.SiteDescription: Fluvial deposits in floodplain of Roberts Creek. Physiography: Driftless Area - rolling. Surrounding vegetation: Farmland.

sites.SiteNotes: Site is located in James 'Pate' Philip State Park.
sites.SiteDescription: Site was a fen, which had been drained, tiled, and cropped since the at least the early 20th century. Since 2003, drain tiles have been removed and fen restoration is in progress.

sites.SiteNotes: Public Land Survey coordinates of the site are NE 1/4, NW 1/4, SW 1/4, Sec. 2, T. 114  N, R. 26 W.
sites.SiteDescription: The site is located on the North bank of a drainage ditch leading to Bevens Creek 6.6 km south of Norwood, Minnesota

Swamp that occupies an irregularly shaped basin that drains to the southwest through an intermittent stream. Surrounding vegetation: Picea rubens, Nyssa sylvatica, and Acer rubrum in the overstory. Ilex, Nemopanthus, Vaccinium, and Viburnum in the understory. Ground layer of Sphagnum, Osmunda, and herbs.

The vast majority of the southern Mojave supports Larrea tridentata and Ambrosia dumosa (bursage) desert scrub. At the lowest elevations (50–425 m), vegetation is typically sparse. These elevations include Atriplex hymenelytra (desert holly), Ambrosia dumosa, and Larrea, with associates that include Encelia farinosa (brittle bush), Peucephyllum schottii (desert spruce) and Hymenoclea salsola
(cheeseweed). At ca. 200–1300 m elevations, Larrea dominates with A. dumosa, Ephedra spp. (Mormon tea), Encelia, Lycium spp. (wolfberry), Ericameria cooperi (golden bush), Krameria parviflora (ratany) and Salazaria mexicana (bladdersage) as secondary
components. More mesophytic upland desert shrubs such as Prunus fasciculata (desert almond), Coleogyne ramosissima (blackbrush), Thamnosma montana (desert rue) and Yucca brevifolia (Joshua tree) are also found ca. 1300–1700 m, occasionally at lower
elevations. The nearby Avawatz Mountains (maximum elevation of 1877 m) support sparse stands of Juniperus osteosperma (Utah juniper). Widespread perennial and annual herbaceous plants include Eriogonum inflatum (desert trumpet),Machaerathera tortifolia (Mojave aster), Eschscholzia minutiflora and E. californica (poppy), Cryptantha spp. (borage), Malvastrum rotundifolium (five-spot mallow), and occasional Hesperocallis undulata (desert
lily). Vegetation growing at the infrequent springs and along perennial watercourses includes Prosopis juliflora (mesquite) and Chilopsis linearis (arroyo willow). An Atriplex (saltbush) community occurs on alkali environments of playas and riverine deposits.
The introduced Bromus rubens (cheatgrass) and Erodium spp. (heron’s bill) are widespread in the study area

Drained wetland in a small depression in ground moraine.
